articles.title: Luis Suarez Controversy Post-Inter Miami Match Followed by Washington Brawl Involving MLS Fans
articles.description: Luis Suarez's polarizing traits had always made him one of soccer's most controversial figures. And he keeps setting the wrong example.
articles.content: The occasion was significant, the result was even more so. And sweeter for the Seattle Sounders. “It’s against one of the best teams in our league, in the world with (Lionel) Messi, the best player in the world, (Luis) Suarez, so many good players, (... [4188 chars]

articles.title: Some of Ukraine’s children start school in underground classrooms to avoid Russian bombs
articles.description: It is just one example of how Ukrainians are adapting to keep life moving with no end in sight to Russia's grinding assault.
articles.content:
BOBRYK, Ukraine (AP) — Pupils were returning to schools in Ukraine on Monday for the start of the new academic year in the hope of being able to study safely under the shadow of Russia’s invasion.
Since the start of the war, in February 2022, schools... [3997 chars]

articles.title: Attacks on US churches have risen significantly since 2021, report finds
articles.description: Attacks targeting churches in the U.S. have increased significantly in recent years, according to a report, and the recent shooting at a Minnesota Catholic school is the latest example.
articles.content:
Attacks targeting churches in the U.S. have increased significantly in recent years, according to a report, and the recent shooting at a Minnesota Catholic school is the latest example.

articles.title: Today in History: Passenger pigeon goes extinct
articles.description: On Sept. 1, 1914, the passenger pigeon, once one of the most abundant bird species on earth, went extinct as the last known example, named Martha, died in captivity at the Cincinnati Zoo.
articles.content:
Today is Monday, Sept. 1, the 244th day of 2025. There are 121 days left in the year.
Today in history:

articles.title: Venice Loves Park Chan-Wook’s ‘No Other Choice’
articles.description: Venice loves Park Chan-wook’s ‘No Other Choice,’ with good reason. It’s a perfect example of how the director coaxes his audience into total identification with people doing insane things.
articles.content:
Photo: NEON
Park Chan-wook’s superpower is his ability to sell us on behavior that would not withstand any kind of scrutiny in other films. Park’s characters do things we might deem irrational or implausible or downright nonsensical in most contexts,... [5333 chars]

articles.title: John Grisham: Jamie Snow deserves clemency
articles.description: The case of Jamie Snow is a shocking example of how the criminal justice system in Bloomington, Illinois, was abused.
articles.content: During the past 35 years, over 3,500 wrongfully convicted Americans have been exonerated and set free. Combined, they served over 32,000 years in prisons from coast to coast. The injustice is everywhere — no state has managed to avoid wrongful convic... [5432 chars]

articles.title: The absurd persecution of Kilmar Abrego Garcia
articles.description: The Salvadoran immigrant has no criminal record, but authorities would make him an example and ship him to Uganda.
